meanings.sent1: I saw a frog squeg in the grass.
meanings.sent2: Please squeg down so you don't scare the rabbit.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to squeg under the fence but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: The toddler squegged down to pick up the fallen toy.
meanings.sent5: She had to squeg to look through the tiny keyhole.

meanings.sent1: The squeg caught us by surprise during the picnic.
meanings.sent2: After the squeg, the streets were flooded.
meanings.sent3: We had to run for cover when the squeg started.
meanings.sent4: The squeg turned the dusty road into a muddy mess.
meanings.sent5: The farmers welcomed the squeg for their crops.

meanings.definition: A small, insignificant person or thing
meanings.sent1: He felt like a squeg in the crowd of talented musicians.
meanings.sent2: The old watch was just a squeg among the valuable antiques.
meanings.sent3: The tiny pebble felt like a squeg in the shoe.
meanings.sent4: The small flower was a squeg compared to the giant tree.
meanings.sent5: The squeg of a bug on the wall went unnoticed.
